featured.text: In medieval Europe, on the other hand, travel documents were issued by local authorities, and generally contained a list of towns and cities which the document holder was permitted to enter or pass through.
Whenever I set foot on the soil of Rwanda, a country in east-central Africa, I feel as if I have entered paradise: green hills, red earth, sparkling rivers and mountain lakes.
Her handwriting has improved a lot after entering the company.
From Binet’s work, the phrase “intelligence quotient” (“IQ”) entered the English vocabulary.
She was invited to enter an invention contest held by her school.

other.text: People enter the world of fantasy for the following reasons EXCEPT that __________.
When Mike enters the living room, (C) the traffic and the noise bothered him greatly. 19.
However, the sea snake’s salt glands cannot handle the massive amounts of salt that would enter their bodies if they actually drank seawater.

But the captain of a ship is responsible for guiding the vessel until they hit a port, waiting to enter the harbor.

Only by entering this quiet mental state 25 a climber really do his or her best.

definition.zh_def: 進入，進來；參加或登錄某個地方或活動。
definition.en_def: To come or go into a place; to participate in or log into an event or system.
definition.example: Please enter your password to access your account.
